New Records: The Cleveland Cavaliers improved to a 7-0 start, matching their best opening record in franchise history.
Key Match Events: Donovan Mitchell made a clutch last-second jumper to give the Cleveland Cavaliers a 114-113 win over the Milwaukee Bucks.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Milwaukee Bucks' Damian Lillard scored 41 points with 10 three-pointers, his highest since joining the team.
Others: The game was significant as it kept the Cavaliers unbeaten and marked the Bucks' fifth consecutive loss after a strong start.
